BusinessName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: The Arc of Atlantic County Inc

IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: Improving the lives of people with intellectual and developmental disabilities in our community. Through direct services, advocacy, education and prevention activities, we work in partnership with individuals and their families to make choices possible about how and where they live, learn, work and play.
IRS990.MissionDesc: The Arc of Atlantic County improves the lives of people with intellectual and developmental disabilities in our community. Through direct services, advocacy, education and prevention activities, we work in partnership with individuals and their families to make choices possible about how and where they live, learn, work and play.
IRS990.Desc: RESIDENTIAL SERVICES:GROUP HOMES- Fifty-two individuals with developmental disabilities live in tweleve homes throughout Atlantic County. Trained staff provide 24-hour supervision along with training and daily living support.SUPERVISED APARTMENTS- Fifty-seven individuals with developmental disabilities live in thirty-seven apartments throughout Atlantic County. Trained staff provide 24-hour assistance along with training and support to help individuals become more independent.COMMUNITY AND SUPPORTIVE LIVING- Seventy individuals with developmental disabilities reside in homes and apartments throughout Atlantic County. Trained staff provide between four and twenty hours of support in order to maintain independent living within the community.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: DAY HABILITATION & EMPLOYMENT SERVICES - Our day habilitation program provides seventy-nine individuals with developmental disabilities, the opportunity to participate in volunteer and leisure activities within the community while building their daily living and social skills. Fifty consumers receive support from the New Jersey Division of Developmental Disabilities and the New Jersey Division of Vocational Rehabilitation as they search and interview for jobs. Once individuals secure a job, staff provides intensive training and follow along job coaching. Staff also assist in job readiness training, prevocational training, and career exploration.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: FAMILY SUPPORT SERVICES- Staff provide in-home and out-of-home respite for families of over 130 individuals with multiple disabilities for up to 20 hours a month. The weekend and after school programs continue to give family members the support they need and a break from the everyday stress of caring for a developmentally disabled family member.

Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.ExplanationTxt: Other income is composed of the following: 1. Management Fees: $11,340 2. Membership Fees: $2,035 3. Miscellaneous Financial Revenue: $37,551

OtherLiabilitiesOrgGrp.Desc: Payable to State of New Jersey

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Management has evaluated uncertain tax positions taken by the Organization. The financial statement effects of a tax position are recognized when the position is more likely than not, based on the technical merits, to be sustained upon examination by the Internal Revenue Service or other taxing authority. The Organization has recognized no interest or penalties related to uncertain tax positions. The Organization is subject to routine audits by taxing jurisdictions; however, there are currently no audits for any tax periods in progress. Management believes it is no longer subject to income tax examinations for years prior to 2014.
Direct Fundraising Expenses -33548. Direct Gaming Expenses -9600.
Direct Fundraising Expenses 33548. Direct Gaming Expenses 9600.

IRS990ScheduleG.GamingManagerServicesProvTxt: Plans, implements, and coordinates the details of the Organization's gaming activities.

GrantsOtherAsstToIndivInUSGrp.GrantTypeTxt: Specific Assistance to Clients including Family Respite, Leisure and Recreation and Clothing.

BusTrInvolveInterestedPrsnGrp.TransactionDesc: Herb Hummel is a broker for a company who obtains health and life insurance plans for the Organization. The broker fees paid by the Organization to Herb's company were $60,550.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 6
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Organization has members. Membership shall be open to persons or organizations who endorse, support or aid the purposes of the Organization.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 7a
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Members shall be allowed to vote for Directors and Officers either in person at the Annual Meeting or by written proxy delivered to The Arc's administrative offices on or before the date of the meeting.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Organization's annual 990 shall be reviewed by the Executive and Audit Committees of the Board of Directors. With their recommendation, the 990 will be distributed to the Board of Directors for their approval, and will be made available on The Arc website and sent to the Internal Revenue Service.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: In the beginning of each year, the Organization has a board of directors meeting in which all board directors are required to complete a form disclosing any conflicts of interest. Forms are then reviewed by mangagement in which disclosed conflicts of interest are addressed accordingly.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The CEO is evaluated annually. At the end of each fiscal year, the board chair initiates the process of evaluation by asking the CEO for a written review of the year, requesting input from board members about the CEO's performance and reviewing relevant salary survey information, which they obtain from the national non-profit board associations. The CEO is typically evaluated against the Strategic Plan approved for the fiscal year being reviewed. In some years personal goals are also established by the CEO and if such goals have been established, they too are part of the evaluation process. The CEO and the board chair meet about the written evaluation and board feedback. The review is discussed with the board in closed session and the results along with any salary and/or benefit change recommendations are approved. Any approved salary changes are submitted by the board chair to the CFO for processing. Top management is evaluated annually by the CEO. The CEO and the board chair meet to discuss top management performance. The results along with approved salary and/or benefit change recommendations are submitted by the board chair to the CFO for processing.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The Organization makes its governing documents, conflict of interest policy and financial statements available to the public upon written request. Form 990 is available on the Organization's website and on guidestar.org.

The Organization has an independent and competent audit committee, appointed by the Board of Directors. The audit committee is responsible for the oversight of the integrity of the Organization's financial accounting process and systems internal controls regarding finance, accounting and use of assets. The committee oversees the independence and performance of the independent auditors.
